channel.title: How do i add the ::comand
channel.description: i am having trouble try in to add ::commands command so when you type it , it comes up with a list. i tried copy and pasting a ::commands from a diff source but didn't work if you have a working ::commands button could you post it or something please? i am using prodigidyscape source and client

item.title: How do i add the ::comand
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

I’m not familiar with your source, so I can’t tell you if this will work properly or not.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { String name = command.substring(5); sendQuest("", 8144); //Title clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("", 8146); sendQuest("", 8147); sendQuest("", 8148); sendQuest("", 8149); sendQuest("", 8150); sendQuest("", 8151); sendQuest("", 8152); sendQuest("", 8153); sendQuest("", 8154); sendQuest("", 8155); sendQuest("", 8156); sendQuest("", 8157); sendQuest("", 8158); sendQuest("", 8159); sendQuest("", 8160); sendQuest("", 8161); sendQuest("", 8162); sendQuest("", 8163); sendQuest("", 8164); sendQuest("", 8165); sendQuest("", 8166); sendQuest("", 8167); sendQuest("", 8168); sendQuest("", 8169); sendQuest("", 8170); sendQuest("", 8171); sendQuest("", 8172); sendQuest("", 8172); sendQuest("", 8173); sendQuest("", 8174); sendQuest("", 8175); sendQuest("", 8176); sendQuest("", 8177); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }

See the sendQuest methods? Well there are quotation marks in every one of them. Inside those quotation marks you type out whatever you want the reader to see.

Read full topic
